simplesect.title: Introduction
simplesect.para: This project represents a fork of &pl.h;, developed independent of the original &pl.h;. As an independent initiative, this is motivated principally for a purpose of facilitating the ongoing development of &pl.h;, furthermore for ensuring the continued availability of &pl.h; for extension in development of free/open source software (FOSS) applications and for purpose of normative reference.

simplesect.title: Components
simplesect.para:
The version 4 releases of &pl.h; are distributed with software components including:
The &stella.h; programming language, in functional subset and knowledge representation subset, with source code for implementation of &stella.h; and the &pl.h; knowledge representation system in Common Lisp, C++, and Java® programming languages
&pl.h; System Support Components, such as for the &pl.h; server (soap system), RDBMS services for &pl.h; (srbc system), and Ontosaurus (?? system)
Text of Example Knowledgebases
Documentation

simplesect.title: Licensing

blockquote.para: Since 2005, PowerLoom® is available free-of-charge under a triple disjunctive open-source licensing scheme that allows you to pick the Mozilla Public License v. 1.1 (MPL), the GNU General Public License v. 2.0 (GPL) or the the GNU Lesser Public License v. 2.1 (LGPL) to fit your needs. This scheme is similar to what's used for the Mozilla web browser and should give people maximum flexibility to use PowerLoom even for commercial development while still retaining the advantages of open-source licensing.

simplesect.para: Except where denoted otherwise, this project retains those licensing stipulations for all contributed files.
